Second switch (i=1) has k=1 bulb s=2 (after s-- becomes 1). So a[1] |= 1 <<1 → a[1] = 2.

Then read M=2 x's. Suppose x1=1, x2=1. Then p = (1 <<0) | (1 <<1) = 3. Then loop s from 0 to 3 (since N=2, 1 <<2 is 4, so s <4). For each s:

s=1 (bit 0): t = a[0] =1. Not 3.

s=2 (bit 1): t = a[1] =2. Not 3.

s=3 (bits 0 and 1): t = 1 ^ 2 =3. So ans becomes 1. So ans is 1. The code outputs 1.

#include <stdio.h>

int main() {
    int N, M;
    scanf("%d %d", &N, &M);
    int a[N];
    for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
        a[i] = 0;
    }
    for (int i = 0; i < M; i++) {
        int k;

                t ^= a[i];
            }
        }
        if (t == p) {
            ans++;
        }
    }
    printf("%d\n", ans);
    return 0;
}
